title: Klondike Gold Rush - Seattle Unit National Historical Park: Curriculum Materials
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Parks as Classrooms     Curriculum Materials                Curriculum Materials       The Klondike Gold Rush was a key event in the economic development of Seattle and the Puget Sound region. In 1897, seventy thousand stampeders headed for Seattle to equip themselves with a year's worth of food, clothing, and equipment so that they could live in the Yukon Territory of Canada as they sought their fortunes                  Impacts of the Klondike Gold Rush Who could imagine what 70,000 Stampeders could do?
